text: It may be that those who do most, dream most.
author: Stephen Butler Leacock

text: So many of our dreams at first seem impossible, then they seem improbable, and then, when we summon the will, they soon become inevitable.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The only thing worse than starting something and failing … is not starting something.
author: Seth Godin

text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: You see things; and you say, ‘Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say, ‘Why not?'
author: George Bernard Shaw
